item.title: 数学题1
item.description: Let $x$ be an integer between $1$ and $10^{12}$, what is the probability that cubic of $x$ ends with $51$? If $x$ ends with $51$, this means that $x^3 \equiv51\pmod{100}$. $$\Leftrightarrow100|x^3-51$$ $$\Leftrightarrow\begin{cases}4|x^3-51 \\ 25|x^3-51\end{cases}$$ $$\Leftrightarrow\begin{cases}4|x^3+1 \\ 25|x^3-1\end{cases}$$ $$\Leftrightarrow\begin{cases}4|(x+1)(x^2-x+1) \\ 25|(x-1)(x^2+x+1)\end{cases}$$ Since $x^2-x+1$ is odd, $$\Leftrightarrow\begin{cases}4|(x+1) \\ 25|(x-1)(x^2+x+1)\end{cases}$$ Let $x = 4k-1$, $k = 1,2,3,\cdots$. $$\Leftrightarrow25|(4k-2)(16k^2-4k+1)$$ Since $$\begin{aligned}16k^2-4k+1 &\equiv k^2-4k+1\pmod{5}\\&\equiv (k-2)^2-3\pmod{5}\end{aligned}$$ Since the square number mod 5 can only be $0,1,4$, therefore
